widgets
Class MT2DManipulator

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.components.MTComponent
      widgets.AbstractGUIWidget
          widgets.MT2DManipulator
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.mt4j.components.interfaces.IMTComponent, org.mt4j.components.interfaces.IMTComponent3D, org.mt4j.input.IMTInputEventListener, org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.IGestureEventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
StdMT2DManipulator
public abstract class MT2DManipulator
extends AbstractGUIWidget

This class represents a 2D-manipulator, which can control and manipulate 2-dimensional values within a specified range. It can be used everywhere, where you need an integrated component with two degrees of freedom.

Version:
20110523
Author:
langenhagen

Method Detail

setValue

public final boolean setValue(float x,
                              float y)
Sets the value of this manipulator. If the value is outside the specified range of this manipulator, nothing happens.

Parameters:
x - The x-value as a float
y - The y-value as a float
Returns:
Returns TRUE if the value was within the permitted range, otherwise returns FALSE

setValueX

public abstract boolean setValueX(float val)
Sets the x-value of this manipulator. If the value is outside the specified x-range of this manipulator, nothing happens.

Parameters:
val - The x-value as a float Returns TRUE if the value was within the permitted range, otherwise returns FALSE

setValueY

public abstract boolean setValueY(float val)
Sets the y-value of this manipulator. If the value is outside the specified y-range of this manipulator, nothing happens.

Parameters:
val - The y-value as a float Returns TRUE if the value was within the permitted range, otherwise returns FALSE

getValue

public abstract org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D getValue()
Retrieves the current value.

Returns:
The current value as an Vector3D. The x-value indicates the x-value, the y-the y-value and the z-value will be undefinded.

Retrieves the current x-value.

Returns:
The current x-value as a float

setRange

public final boolean setRange(float min_x,
                              float max_x,
                              float min_y,
                              float max_y)
Sets the range of the manipulator. If some minimum-value is bigger than its corresponding maximum-value, nothing happens.

Parameters:
min_x - The minimum x-value as a float
max_x - The maximum x-value as a float
min_y - The minimum y-value as a float
max_y - The maximum x-value as a float
Returns:
Returns TRUE if the action was successful, otherwise returns FALSE

setSnapBackValue

public abstract boolean setSnapBackValue(float x,
                                         float y)
Determines the position, which is initial in case of snapping back. If the specified Values are out of range, nothing happens.

Parameters:
x - The initial x-value as a float
y - The initial y-value as a float
Returns:
Returns TRUE if action was successful, otherwise returns FALSE

getSnapBackValue

public abstract org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D getSnapBackValue()
Retrieves the snap-back-value.

Returns:
The snap-back-value as a Vector3D

setSnapBackEnabled

public abstract void setSnapBackEnabled(boolean b)
Determines, wether the cursor should snap back to an initial value/position after a gesture On this manipulator ended.

Parameters:
b - The indicator, where TRUE indicates snapping back, FALSE indicates no snapping back

isSnapBackEnabled

public abstract boolean isSnapBackEnabled()
Specifies, if snapping back is enabled.

Returns:
Returns TRUE, if snapping back is enabled, otherwise returns FALSE.
